Chapter 5: Conditions, in the section on non-questions. Conditions are skillfully used, conditions are skillfully understood.

If this exists due to that cause, if there is no cause there is no this, if this arises there is the arising of that, if this ceases there is the cessation of that.

If this Dharma is so, then it is not otherwise, not different, not different from things, a permanent Dharma, a true Dharma, a Dharma that abides, a Dharma that is fixed. Such conditions are called conditions.
What are the dharmas that arise from conditions?
Aging and death are impermanent, conditioned, arisen from causes, subject to cessation, subject to change, subject to dispassion, subject to cessation.

Up to ignorance is impermanent, conditioned, arisen from causes, subject to cessation, subject to change, subject to dispassion, subject to cessation. These are called the dharmas that arise from conditions.
What is the skillful means of conditions?

Bhikshus!
What is meant by skillful means of good conditions?
To know and see as it really is the dharmas that arise from this condition, this is called skillful means of good conditions.
What is ignorance?
The unwholesome root of delusion is called ignorance.
What is the condition of ignorance giving rise to volitional formations?
Ignorance conditions meritorious volitional formations, demeritorious volitional formations, and imperturbable volitional formations.
What are demeritorious volitional formations?
Unwholesome bodily actions, unwholesome verbal actions, and unwholesome mental actions.
What are unwholesome bodily actions?
If a person lacks wisdom and does not eliminate ignorance, engaging in killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, and other unwholesome bodily actions, these are called unwholesome bodily actions.
What are unwholesome verbal actions?

If a person lacks wisdom and ignorance has not yet been eliminated, and they engage in false speech, divisive speech, harsh speech, frivolous speech, and other unwholesome verbal actions, this is called unwholesome verbal action.
What is unwholesome mental action?
If a person lacks wisdom and ignorance has not yet been eliminated, and they give rise to covetousness, ill-will, and wrong views, this is called unwholesome mental action.
These unwholesome actions of body, speech, and mind are called unwholesome actions, and ignorance is the condition for present actions.
What are wholesome actions?
Wholesome actions of body, speech, and mind.
What are wholesome actions of body?

If a person lacks wisdom and ignorance has not yet been eliminated, and they refrain from killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct, and engage in other wholesome bodily actions, this is called wholesome bodily action.
What are wholesome actions of speech?

If a person lacks wisdom and ignorance has not yet been eliminated, and they refrain from false speech, divisive speech, harsh speech, frivolous speech, and engage in other wholesome verbal actions, this is called wholesome verbal action.
What are wholesome actions of mind?
If a person is without wisdom and ignorance has not yet been eliminated, without greed and without hatred, with right view, this is called good mental action.
This good bodily, verbal, and mental action is called meritorious action conditioned by ignorance in the present life.

Furthermore, if a person is without wisdom and ignorance has not yet been eliminated, being free from desire and evil unwholesome states, with initial and sustained thought, detached joy, and bliss, accomplishing the first meditation, their bodily action without teaching is included in the precepts and is cognized by mental consciousness, their verbal action without teaching is included in the precepts and is cognized by mental consciousness, and their mental action arises from the mind and includes feeling, perception, intention, contact, and thought.
Such good bodily, verbal, and mental action is called meritorious action conditioned by ignorance in the present life.

Furthermore, if a person lacks wisdom and ignorance has not yet been eliminated, and the practice of the second dhyÄna is accomplished by extinguishing initial and sustained thought, inwardly having faith in the mind, being without initial thought and sustained thought, giving rise to concentration, joy, and pleasure, then the bodily action that is the dharmas of precepts without teaching is included in the aggregate of form and is cognized by mental consciousness, the verbal action that is the dharmas of precepts without teaching is included in the aggregate of form and is cognized by mental consciousness, and the mental action that arises from the mind, such as feeling, conception, volition, contact, and thought, and the bodily, verbal, and mental good conduct, are called meritorious actions with ignorance as a condition in the present life.

Furthermore, if a person lacks wisdom and ignorance has not yet been eliminated, and the practice of the third dhyÄna is accomplished by being detached from joy, practicing equanimity, being mindful and aware, experiencing bodily pleasure, and practicing equanimity, mindfulness, and pleasure as understood by the noble ones, then the bodily action that is the dharmas of precepts without teaching is included in the aggregate of form and is cognized by mental consciousness, the verbal action that is the dharmas of precepts without teaching is included in the aggregate of form and is cognized by mental consciousness, and the mental action that arises from the mind, such as feeling, conception, volition, contact, and thought, and the bodily, verbal, and mental good conduct, are called meritorious actions with ignorance as a condition in the present life.

Furthermore, if a person lacks wisdom and ignorance has not yet been eliminated, and they have already extinguished suffering and pleasure, and previously extinguished joy and sorrow, and are in the fourth dhyÄna state of neither suffering nor joy, with pure mindfulness and equanimity, their bodily actions that are not manifest but are precepts are included in the aggregate of form and are cognized by mental consciousness, their verbal actions that are not manifest but are precepts are included in the aggregate of form and are cognized by mental consciousness, and their mental actions that arise from the mind, such as feelings, perceptions, intention, contact, and thought, as well as their bodily, verbal, and mental good conduct, are called meritorious actions with ignorance as a condition in the present life.
This is called meritorious action.
What is called imperturbable action?

If a person lacks wisdom and ignorance has not yet been eliminated, they have transcended all perceptions of form, eliminated perceptions of repugnance, and do not think of various perceptions, and have accomplished the practice of the sphere of infinite space, their bodily actions that are not manifest but are precepts are included in the aggregate of form and are cognized by mental consciousness, their verbal actions that are not manifest but are precepts are included in the aggregate of form and are cognized by mental consciousness, and their mental actions that arise from the mind, such as feelings, perceptions, intention, contact, and thought, as well as their bodily, verbal, and mental good conduct, are called imperturbable actions with ignorance as a condition in the present life.

Furthermore, if a person lacks wisdom and ignorance has not yet been eliminated, and they leave the sphere of infinite space and accomplish the sphere of infinite consciousness, their bodily actions that are not taught by precepts are included in the mental consciousness, their verbal actions that are not taught by precepts are included in the mental consciousness, and their mental actions arise from the mind and include feelings, perceptions, intention, contact, and thought. Such wholesome bodily, verbal, and mental actions are called unmoving actions with ignorance as a condition in the present life.

Furthermore, if a person lacks wisdom and ignorance has not yet been eliminated, and they leave the sphere of infinite consciousness and accomplish the sphere of nothingness, their bodily actions that are not taught by precepts are included in the mental consciousness, their verbal actions that are not taught by precepts are included in the mental consciousness, and their mental actions arise from the mind and include feelings, perceptions, intention, contact, and thought. Such wholesome bodily, verbal, and mental actions are called unmoving actions with ignorance as a condition in the present life.

Furthermore, if a person lacks wisdom and ignorance has not yet been eliminated, and they are free from the sphere of nothingness and have attained the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, their bodily actions, unmanifested precepts, and dharmas included in the sense base of mental objects are cognized by the mental consciousness; their verbal actions, unmanifested precepts, and dharmas included in the sense base of mental objects are cognized by the mental consciousness; their mental actions, feelings, perceptions, volition, contact, and thought that arise from the mind, and such wholesome bodily, verbal, and mental actions, are called the present actions conditioned by the ignorance of the immovable.
This is called the immovable actions.

Furthermore, if a person lacks wisdom and ignorance has not yet been eliminated, and they perform unwholesome bodily, verbal, and mental actions, and due to performing unwholesome actions, their body perishes, their life ends, and they fall into the hells, the animal realm, or the realm of hungry ghosts, and due to the causal conditions, they fall into the hells, the animal realm, or the realm of hungry ghosts and receive a body with five aggregates.
In this way, the present actions condition the future actions that are received. This is called the future actions conditioned by ignorance.

Furthermore, if a person lacks wisdom and ignorance has not yet been eliminated, they perform contaminated wholesome bodily actions and will receive birth in the desire realm, perform contaminated wholesome verbal and mental actions and will receive birth in the desire realm. Having performed wholesome actions, when the body perishes and life ends, they are reborn among humans or in the heavens of the desire realm, and due to the conditions of causes and circumstances, they receive the body of five aggregates among humans or in the heavens of the desire realm.
In this way, conditions of present actions receive future actions, which is called ignorance as a condition for future actions.

Furthermore, if a person lacks wisdom and ignorance has not yet been eliminated, they perform contaminated wholesome bodily actions and will receive birth in the form realm, perform contaminated wholesome verbal and mental actions and will receive birth in the form realm. due to the conditions of causes and circumstances, they receive the body of five aggregates in the heavens of the form realm.

Due to the causal conditions, they experience the body of four aggregates in the formless heavens.

In this way, the present formations give rise to future consciousness, which is called the condition of formations giving rise to future consciousness.

In this way, future actions receive future consciousness, which is called the future consciousness conditioned by formations.

Furthermore, if a person lacks wisdom and ignorance has not yet been eliminated, they perform contaminated wholesome bodily actions that will lead to rebirth in the desire realm, perform contaminated wholesome verbal and mental actions that will lead to rebirth in the desire realm, and after performing these wholesome actions, when their body perishes and their life ends, they are reborn among humans or in the heavens of the desire realm. In this way, future actions give rise to future consciousness, which is called the condition of action giving rise to future consciousness.

Furthermore, if a person lacks wisdom and ignorance has not yet been eliminated, they perform contaminated wholesome bodily actions that will lead to rebirth in the form realm, perform contaminated wholesome verbal and mental actions that will lead to rebirth in the form realm, and after performing these wholesome actions, when their body perishes and their life ends, they are reborn in the heavens of the form realm. In this way, future actions give rise to future consciousness, which is called the condition of action giving rise to future consciousness.

Furthermore, if a person lacks wisdom and ignorance has not yet been eliminated, they perform contaminated wholesome bodily actions that will lead to rebirth in the formless realm, perform contaminated wholesome verbal and mental actions that will lead to rebirth in the formless realm, and upon the destruction of the body and the end of life, are reborn in the formless heavens. Due to the causal conditions, in the formless heavens there is immovable volition and the consciousness associated with that volition.
In this way, future actions give rise to future consciousness, which is called the condition of action as the cause of future consciousness.

Furthermore, if the final action is unknown and ceases, or if the immediately preceding action ceases and consciousness continues and is born in another path, that action is the condition of that action as the immediately preceding condition.

The last moment of consciousness ceases, and the first moment of consciousness continues in another path. When the last moment of consciousness ceases, the first moment of consciousness arises immediately, without anything in between.
It is like the shadow moving and the sun continuing, the sun moving and the shadow continuing. There is nothing in between the shadow and the sun.

In the same way, the last moment of consciousness ceases, and the first moment of consciousness continues in another path. When the last moment of consciousness ceases, it immediately experiences the first moment of consciousness, without anything in between.
The associated dharmas of the first moment of consciousness or the last moment of consciousness do not reach the subsequent moment of consciousness.
It is like the eye consciousness ceasing and the ear consciousness arising, the ear consciousness ceasing and the eye consciousness arising.
The associated dharmas of the eye consciousness do not reach the ear consciousness, and the associated dharmas of the ear consciousness do not reach the eye consciousness.

In this way, the final consciousness and the dharmas associated with the final consciousness do not reach the first consciousness, and the first consciousness and the dharmas associated with the first consciousness do not reach the subsequent consciousness.

When the subsequent consciousness ceases, it immediately gives rise to the first consciousness. It is said that when this passes, when this ceases that arises, when this ends that begins. It is not that the life is the body, nor that the life and body are different, nor is it eternal or annihilated, nor does it go or come, nor does it change, nor is it without cause or without action, nor does one create and experience oneself, nor does another create and experience differently. In this way, the future consciousness gives rise to the future name. This is called consciousness being the condition for the future name.

If the created karma is already accomplished, and one receives the four kinds of self-identities of form, feeling, perception, and consciousness in the formless heavens, this is called formless existence being the same as birth existence.
This is called receiving existence, this is called resultant existence, and this is called further existence.
Such formless karmic actions and such formless birth existence are called formless existence.

How does birth condition old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, distress, and the great mass of pain?
What is old age?
It refers to the aging, decay, and deterioration of the faculties of sentient beings, and the decrease of mindfulness and practice, this is called old age.
What is death?

If sentient beings die and their life ends, when the time passes and the aggregates disintegrate, they abandon the body, and this aggregate changes and the multitude is separated, this is called death.
What is worry?
When sentient beings encounter various painful dharmas, if they are worried, very worried, ultimately worried, internally hot, internally sorrowful, this is called worry.
What is grief?

Being constrained by worry, being oppressed by worry, being fully worried, being mentally disturbed by worry, lamenting to the extreme, crying, recollecting with regret, speaking in succession, or beating oneself and speaking in confusion, this is called grief.
What is suffering?
If one experiences suffering with the body, from eye contact with suffering up to body contact with suffering, this is called suffering.
What is distress?
If one experiences suffering with the mind, from mind contact with suffering, this is called distress.
What is a great mass of suffering?
If it is a multitude of sufferings, if it is the suffering of scolding and humiliation, if the mind is not settled, this is called a great mass of suffering.
